description.narrative: South Sudan Peace and Prosperity Promotion Programme MinBuza. Overall programme oversight will be ensured by a Programme Advisory Committee composed of the Associate Country Director of Oxfam Novib, Deputy Country Director of Oxfam GB and Head of Programs of Oxfam Intermon and representatives from the implementing Oxfam Novib partners. The day-to-day overall coordination, development of overall programme initiatives as well as support to the various programmes will be the responsibility of a Oxfam NovibProgramme Coordinator located within the premises of Oxfam GB in Juba, South Sudan. The Programme Coordinator will also be responsible for consolidated reporting on the programme to MOFA as well as provide MOFA with a single point of contact and communication. Financial managementand donor reporting will also be hosted by Oxfam Novib and a Financial Manager experienced in managing complex programmes will support the programme with regard to all financial and administrative matters. Monitoring, evaluation and learning (including cross-programme learning) will be hosted within Oxfam Novib and will include a dedicated Global MEL Advisor (who will report to and be matrix-managed by the Knowledge and Programme Department of Oxfam Novib in The Hague). A Global Conflict Transformation Advisor will be assigned by Oxfam Novib to provide expert knowledge and programmatic advice to the program on the issues conflict transformation, governance, peace building and post-conflict reconstruction and who is line managed by the Knowledge and Programme Department of OxfamNovib in The Hague.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: no. of women and men (small-scale crop farmers, cattle farmers, fisher folk) able to use sustainable production methods enabling them to better protect and use sustainably their livelihood resources
